meanings.sent1: The movie was so uncompelling that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent2: The book's plot was uncompelling, and I struggled to finish it.
meanings.sent3: The presentation was so uncompelling that even the speaker seemed bored.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was as uncompelling as watching paint dry.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement was incredibly uncompelling, failing to attract any customers.

meanings.sent1: His argument was uncompelling, and no one was swayed by it.
meanings.sent2: The evidence presented in court was uncompelling, leading to the defendant's acquittal.
meanings.sent3: The sales pitch was so uncompelling that even the most gullible person wouldn't buy it.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were as uncompelling as a wet noodle.
meanings.sent5: The politician's promises were uncompelling, leaving voters skeptical of his intentions.
